TEXT: The applicant is an NORP national , born in DATE and currently residing in PERSON .
The facts of the present case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant started suffering from a rare and serious illness called metabolic myopathy in DATE . Metabolic myopathy provokes physical exhaustion , severe myalgia , difficulties in breathing , loss of the power of speech . The applicant in particular suffers from a " thermal disability " i.e. cold temperatures and changes in temperature cause him intense muscular pain . He is often forced to use a wheelchair .
However , the applicant ’s illness was not diagnosed until DATE . Prior to that date , the applicant was thought to be a psychopath .
In DATE the applicant was recognised as PERCENT disabled and started receiving a pension as a result .

The applicant embarked on a series of actions and demonstration , including hunger strikes , in order to obtain the removal of architectural obstructions ( barriere architettoniche ) and to obtain some form of social help .

On an unspecified date in DATE , as a consequence of CARDINAL of these actions , the applicant was allegedly ill - treated by the police . On DATE the applicant filed a criminal complaint against the police in relation to the above facts , which was however dismissed .
The applicant ’s detention

On an unspecified date the applicant requested the President of the Province of PERSON to enforce provincial law no . CARDINAL of DATE , which , inter alia , imposes certain obligations upon the provincial social security service to help those suffering from metabolic myopathy . The President of the GPE of PERSON filed a criminal complaint against the applicant for extortion , on the ground that he had tried to force the administrative authorities to favour him . On DATE , the applicant was arrested .

On DATE , after CARDINAL medical experts’ reports had established that the applicant ’s physical condition was not compatible with detention , he was released . The charge against him was then converted from extortion into " arbitrary and violent exercise of his rights " ( esercizio arbitrario delle proprie ragioni con violenza alle persone ) , but later dropped , no formal complaint having been lodged against him on this charge ( non doversi procedere per difetto di querela ) .

On DATE ORG awarded the applicant compensation ( MONEY ) for the CARDINAL-day unfair detention ( ingiusta detenzione ) , on the ground that the charge against him had been dropped and in consideration of his poor state of health .
However , on DATE ORG lodged an appeal against this decision to ORG . These proceedings are currently pending .
The applicant ’s accommodation

Since DATE the applicant had lived in a privately rented apartment in via Suffragio no . MONEY ( hereinafter referred to as “ the first apartment ” ) , which he had adapted , at his own expense , to his needs in view of his pathology .

In DATE ORG , hereinafter referred to as " ITEA " ) expropriated the building . ITEA intended to renovate the building , and tried therefore to find another suitable accommodation for the applicant , who demanded the respect of certain criteria and technical characteristics .

On DATE , an apartment located in via Suffragio no . CARDINAL ( hereinafter referred to as “ the second apartment ” ) was allocated to the applicant by ORG ; the applicant moved into it , despite the fact that he considered it to be inadequate to his needs .
On DATE the applicant and ITEA entered into the relevant lease contract ; the rent was fixed at MONEY per month .
In DATE provincial law no . CARDINAL was enacted , according to which ORG has an obligation to provide persons who are recognised as PERCENT disabled with accommodation meeting their specific needs .
In DATE the applicant ceased the payment of the rent , demanding that certain works be carried out in the apartment with a view to making it fit for his needs .

On DATE ORG instructed a lawyer to commence proceedings with a view to recovering the arrears of rent from the applicant and to recovering possession of the apartment . On an unspecified date , the ORG formally confirmed the notice to quit and set the date of the applicant ’s eviction at DATE .
On DATE ITEA submitted to the applicant a plan of payments of the arrears over CARDINAL instalments ; this proposal was refused .

On DATE ORG decided to refrain from requesting the enforcement of the ORG ’s order for possession for DATE , in consideration of the applicant ’s health condition and of his alleged credit towards ORG on account of the expenses he had incurred in order to adapt the apartment to his needs .
On DATE ORG acknowledged part of the amounts claimed by the applicant .
On DATE , the applicant paid part of his outstanding debt to ORG .
In connection with the remainder of the applicant ’s debt and for the legal costs and expenses incurred by ORG , the enforcement of the eviction order was pursued and fixed at DATE .

On DATE the applicant , after having occupied as a protest the hall of FAC , poured QUANTITY of petrol around the building where his flat is . He was arrested and subsequently convicted . In the meantime , the other occupants of the building had to vacate it for DATE .

On DATE ITEA submitted to the applicant another plan of payment of the arrears of rent and legal costs and expenses . The applicant replied that he was ready to pay for the arrears of rent but not for the legal costs and expenses .
On DATE ORG instructed its lawyer to pursue the applicant ’s eviction .
On DATE ORG requested the assistance of ORG of PERSON ( PERSON per i Servizi Sanitari della GPE di PERSON ) , which accepted .
The eviction was postponed until DATE . The applicant ’s lawyer requested ORG to refrain form the eviction so that he could find a solution . The new date for the eviction was fixed at DATE .
On DATE and DATE , however , ORG decided to stay the eviction until DATE .
On DATE ORG requested the applicant to demolish certain parts he had illegally built on his balcony , in pursuance of an order issued by the municipality on DATE .
On DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG decided to stay the applicant ’s eviction .

On DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG decided to stay the applicant ’s eviction for DATE , pending the proceedings opened by the PERSON municipality with a view to withdrawing the allocation of the second apartment to the applicant .
On DATE the ORG revoked the allocation of the apartment to the applicant pursuant to provincial law no . CARDINAL , on account of the repeated breaches of the terms of contract by the applicant .

The applicant alleges that he was not served notice of this decision . The Government maintain that he received notification of it on DATE and submit that the applicant failed to lodge an appeal to the competent ORG ( PERSON ) and was thus informed , on DATE , that the decision on withdrawal was final but that he had the possibility of requesting that its enforcement be suspended .

In a report issued on DATE by ORG of PERSON it was stated that the second apartment did not meet the requirements laid down in the relevant legislation . In particular : a ) access to the WC is difficult for a disabled person ; b ) the bathtub is inadequate for the hydrotherapy needed by the applicant ; c ) the windows are not triple glazed ; d ) there is no structural separation between the apartment and the loft ; d ) the roof is not adequately insulated due to the presence of cracks .

On DATE the applicant ’s eviction was stayed for DATE . ITEA inquired whether the decision on withdrawal could be suspended but the Province informed it that it was not possible in the absence of a request by the applicant . By a note of CARDINAL DATE , GPE confirmed that the applicant had never requested the suspension of the decision on withdrawal .
On DATE the applicant was evicted . He went to live in a camper van parked in the main square of PERSON .

On DATE the GPE informed ORG of PERSON to be ready to allocate to the applicant , upon his request , a place in a home for the sick and to request ORG for the study of metabolic diseases ( PERSON malattie metaboliche ) , set up by GPE PERSON and composed of CARDINAL medical doctors , to express its opinion as to whether the applicant needed to be accommodated in CARDINAL of these homes .

On DATE the applicant filed an application with the Magistrate ’s Court of PERSON requesting , inter alia , that the second apartment be adapted to his needs and that he be reinstated in it . However , by an ordinance issued on DATE the ORG declared its incompetence to grant the applicant ’s requests and thus rejected them . The court pointed out that it was for the administrative courts to order ITEA to comply with its obligation and to provide the applicant with an adequate apartment .
On DATE the Commission for the study of metabolic diseases issued a report on the applicant ’s case listing the requirements which the applicant ’s accommodation should meet .
In connection with the arrears of rent , on DATE the ORG issued an injunction of payment .

On DATE the provincial body on residential housing ( FAC della GPE autonoma di PERSON ) stated that it would not be possible to allocate another apartment to the applicant , on account of his insolvency .

On DATE the applicant was hospitalised in PERSON ; his condition has dramatically deteriorated on account of his living in an inadequate environment ( camper van ) . On DATE the applicant went on hunger strike . In a report issued on DATE by a commission of doctors from the hospital , it was stated that the applicant should be discharged from hospital due to the lack of facilities adequate to his illness and that therefore a solution to his housing problem was urgently needed .
On DATE the applicant ’s moveable items were seized from the second apartment with a view to recovering the arrears of rent owed by the applicant .

On DATE the health and social affairs councillor ’s office ( assessorato alla sanità e attività sociali ) of GPE decided that it would try to find an institution which would accept to bear the costs for the rent and maintenance of the apartment for the applicant , pursuant to LAW no . CARDINAL . The apartment would thus be formally allocated to this institution , which would then make it available for the applicant . On DATE a representative of the councillor ’s office was formally appointed to this task .

In co - operation with the PERSON municipality , CARDINAL apartments owned by ORG were found ; ORG for the study of metabolic diseases was requested to inspect them with a view to finding a suitable one .

By a note of CARDINAL DATE , ORG for the study of metabolic diseases stated to have found that the one in Aldeno ( hereinafter referred to as “ the third apartment ” ) was suitable . The applicant was informed accordingly .

By a decision of DATE , the PERSON dell’Adige of GPE allocated the third apartment to the applicant . ORG for the study of metabolic diseases pointed out that certain works needed to be carried out in the third apartment with a view to making it fully adequate to the applicant ’s medical condition , and the PERSON stated that it would proceed with the works after the applicant ’s formal acceptance of the apartment .
The applicant however refused to accept the third apartment and to leave the hospital .

On DATE the Director of ORG , having learned that a suitable apartment had been put at the applicant ’s disposal , requested the latter to leave the hospital , as his presence there was not needed any more and the place he occupies in the hospital was necessary for other patients .
On DATE the applicant was formally discharged from hospital . The Director of the ORG has requested the police to evict the applicant .
